intro: Felicia oleosa, commonly known as the yellow daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. It typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant color and long blooming period.
